conclusion: Use the ideal gas law and properties of processes in the p-V diagram to find temperature at state C.
A to B is an isochoric process; B to C is an isobaric process.
Temperature at state A is 27°C or 300 K.
Pressure at state A is 3 x 10^5 Pa; Volume at state A is 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
Pressure at states B and C is 1 x 10^5 Pa; Volume at state C is 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate nR at state A: nR = 1.
Determine temperature at state C: T_C = 300 K.
The temperature of the gas at state C is 300 K or 27°C.
